alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 5:57PM EST until March 08 at 1:40AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... White River, Wabash River. .Multiple rounds of recent precipitation, preceded by snow melt, will keep minor flooding ongoing along much of the East Fork White, lower White and Wabash rivers. Moderate flooding is occurring on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel, and on the White River at Hazleton. The crest on the Wabash River is near Mount Carmel, and the crest on the White River is between Petersburg and Hazleton. The East Fork White River is slowly rising near Rivervale and points downstream. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is expected to last into the second week of March. The East Fork White river is expected to remain in flood until about March 5. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MARCH 08... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, March 08. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Water from the Great June 2008 Flood recedes from SR 257 south of Washington. The river stage at Shoals was less than 10 feet and less than 14 feet previous day. The Lost River was low...except for backwater from the East Fork White...during this entire flood event. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Sunday /4:30 PM CST Sunday/ the stage was 23.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Sunday /4:30 PM CST Sunday/ was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, March 7. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1200 PM CST /100 PM EST/.
